Lonely, Retired and Longing for 'Twilight Love' An Outlier Court That Trump Sees as a Model

By ALEXANDRA STEVENSON SHANGHAI - For Shanghai's lonely and retired, love is elusive.
Divorced or widowed residents gather in a dating corner in Peo-
ple's Park every weekend looking ples Park every weekend tooking
for a chat. They mill about an Ikea canteen on Tuesdays in search of some fun.
They arrive dressed a little
nicer than nicer than usual, ready to ta
about their virtues, their past lives and the future.

Looking for a Spark at Shanghai Meet-Ups

Xiaoduo, 70 , a twice-divorced former primary-school teacher who
volunteers details about his penvolunteers details about his pen-
sion (around $\$ 1,250$ a month) and his dancing abilities (very good).

egulations. It made it harder to prosecute former presidents. And delivered another decision that
